content.raw:
This function is creating a new entity for the world and creating all the models as children of that world. So we end up with 2 world entities, one which loaded this plugin (the `Entity` received in `Configure`), and the new one.

I _think_ this is now causing any problems right now, but there will be a disconnect between the plugins loaded together with `LogPlayback` at startup and the plugins loaded from the recorded file, so we probably want to avoid creating a new world entity here.
content.html:
This function is creating a new entity for the world and creating all the models as children of that world. So we end up with 2 world entities, one which loaded this plugin (the Entity received in Configure), and the new one.

I think this is now causing any problems right now, but there will be a disconnect between the plugins loaded together with LogPlayback at startup and the plugins loaded from the recorded file, so we probably want to avoid creating a new world entity here.
